Detailed Description

Derived from Volume, representing a parallelepiped in space.

The parallelepiped can reflect and refract Launchables. It can be intersected by a Launchable from inside or outside

Constructor.

Constructor of class Parallelepiped

Parameters:
absorp : absorption probability
reflect : reflection probability
refract : refraction probability
index : index (material) of this Parallelepiped
tex : pointer to the texture of this Parallelepiped
corner : one point of the volume
x,y,z : orientation of the parallelepiped (norms precise sizes)

Member Function Documentation

std::pair< Ray, Ray > Parallelepiped::divide_ray ( const Couple3D &  couple,
const Ray &  ray 
) const [virtual]

Returns the division (reflected/refracted) of an incoming ray at the couple position.

Parameters:
ray : the incoming ray to divide
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second parameter contains the normal at this intersection

This function divides a ray into a reflected and refracted ray only if the new ray can exist (probabilities not null). In case of a total reflection, the refracted ray has a null direction

Implements Shape.

Color Parallelepiped::get_color_at ( const Point3D &  inters_point  )  const [virtual]

Returns the color at this point of the parallelepiped.

Parameters:
inters_point : an intersection point where we seek the color

This function determines the color at the given point of the surface It is related to the get_color(double, double) of the Texture where the two doubles represent coordinates for the texture map.

Implements Shape.

Couple3D Parallelepiped::get_nearest_intersection_with_normal ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns the nearest intersection (point/normal) of the given launchable with this parallelepiped.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to find intersection with

This function returns a couple containing the nearest intersection point (first param) with this Parallelepiped and the normal at intersection point (second param)

Implements Shape.

Couple3D Parallelepiped::get_random_point_and_normal (  )  const [virtual]

Returns a random surface point and a random normal of the parallelepiped.

Returns a couple containing as first parameter a random point of the surface of the parallelepiped from where to emit, and a corresponding normal as second parameter

Implements Volume.

bool Parallelepiped::is_intersected_by ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns whether this parallelepiped is intersected by a given launchable.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to test collision with

This function returns whether the launchable direction will lead to a collision with this parallelepiped

Implements Shape.

bool Parallelepiped::redirect_photon ( const Couple3D &  couple,
Photon &  ph 
) const [virtual]

Redirects (or not) a given photon depending on the probilities of this parallelepiped.

Parameters:
ph : the incoming photon to redirect
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second contains the normal at this intersection

This function determines if a photon will be aborbed, reflected or refracted depending on the corresponding probabilities specified for this parallelepiped It returns TRUE is the photon was redirected, and FALSE if the photon was absorbed.

Implements Shape.
